name: Quinoa Tuna Salad
author: Julie
summary: This high-protein dish makes a great side to any main course, or even a complete meal.
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained and rinsed
1 (15 ounce) can black olives, drained and sliced
1 (14.5 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained
2 tablespoons olive oil, or more if needed
2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, or more to taste
directions: Bring quinoa and water to a boil in a saucepan
Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the quinoa is tender and the water has been absorbed, about 15 to 20 minutes
Combine garbanzo beans, black olives, corn, tuna, spinach, tomatoes, olive oil, and cilantro in a large bowl; stir to coat
Refrigerate salad to allow flavors to blend, 2 hours to overnight
